title: Basics of Webpack
headline: Discover how to use Webpack for resolving common issues to create quality JavaScript apps in this free online course.
description: Webpack is one of the tools available for bundling JavaScript files into a single file with a rich plugin interface. This free online Webpack course will give you a clear understanding of core concepts to solve the problem of bundling and how it differs from other technologies. Discover how to develop custom web applications using a modular approach and the stages involved in adding new features and capabilities to a project.

courseDescription:
Are you looking for a comprehensive course to enhance your Java skills and experience? This course will give you in-depth knowledge about the features and capabilities of Webpack, core concepts and how it works to start building your JavaScript applications. We will also cover how to install, configure and test it successfully. Learn how to set up and create a new project using online web applications. Find out how to solve browser caching issues using cache busting in Webpack to improve web application performance.

Additionally, you will learn how to create a workspace in Cloud9 and install Angular CLI, Node and others. Find out why we need Webpack plugins and how to extract all CSS into a separate CSS file. Discover how to configure Webpack-dev-server to make our development process faster and more convenient. Learn how to bundle a JavaScript application with bundle.js files in Webpack. Familiarize yourself with the command that will run Webpack in ‘watch’ mode and the various types of loaders.

Finally, we will demonstrate how to install, configure and run Webpack. Discover how to upgrade node and npm versions within the Codeanywhere workspace environment. Anyone with a background in HTML, web servers and configuration will benefit from this fascinating course. People lacking experience or skills can also learn valuable information from this field of study. By the end of this course, you will create a web application with better performance. Jumpstart your career as a professional web developer today and enroll now!

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn how to code a Webpack-enabled JavaScript project from scratch and add more Webpack features and capabilities to the project. Discover the steps for installing, configuring and running Webpack before delving into using node.js and npm package manager.
